"We don't make mistakes; we just have happy accidents."
"If you've never lived with a squirrel, you haven't lived."
"Let's get crazy."
"Just beat the devil out of it."
"I like to beat the brush."
"I really believe that if you practice enough you could paint the 'Mona Lisa' with a two-inch brush."
"Just go out and talk to a tree. Make friends with it."
"In painting, you have unlimited power. You have the ability to move mountains. You can bend rivers."
"You need the dark in order to show the light."
"Look around. Look at what we have. Beauty is everywhere - you only have to look to see it."
"The secret to doing anything is believing that you can do it."
"Anything that you believe you can do strong enough, you can do. Anything. As long as you believe."
"You have unlimited power on this canvas."
"I guess I'm a little weird. I like to talk to trees and animals. That's okay though; I have more fun than most people."
"There's nothing wrong with having a tree as a friend."
"Even a tree needs a friend."
"I've already covered the canvas with a thin, even coat of liquid white."
"It's wet, slick, and ready to go."
"You can do anything you want to do. This is your world."
"Here's your bravery test!"
"This is your world, and you have to design it the way you want it."
"I still have not cleaned the brush. I'm lazy."
"Let's have some fun."
"Just before the show I went to the bathroom. Needless to say, with a wireless mic, when I came back everybody knew where I'd been."
"Three hairs and some air."
"When you pull it, wiggle it."
"It's a good day to be alive. Come to think of it, every day's a good day to be alive."
"Big ol' tree."
"I'm sure there's a proper name for these clouds. I just call 'em little stringy clouds."
"I know there's an ol' coyote sitting out there. I can just sort of feel it."
"I know you're saying already, \"Bob, you've messed this one up.\" You may be right."
"Painting offers you freedom."
"You can make these clouds with a one-inch brush, two-inch brush, fan brush. Shoot, you could make 'em with your shoe."
"This year, I raised seven little birds."
"Caress the canvas; make love to it."
"From all of us here: Happy painting, and God bless."
"Talent is a pursued interest. Anything that you're willing to practice, you can do."
"I can't think of anything more rewarding than being able to express yourself to others through painting."
"Exercising the imagination, experimenting with talents, being creative - these things, to me, are truly the windows to your soul."
"I started painting as a hobby when I was little; I didn't know I had any talent. I believe talent is just a pursued interest. Anybody can do what I do."
"Lets build a happy little cloud. Lets build some happy little trees."
"Let your imagination take you anywhere you want to go."
"Anybody can put a masterpiece on canvas with just a little practice."
"Very gently, lift upward."
"Trees cover up a multitude of sins."
"Tell you what, let's do put a little cloud in there."
"I like to do trees."
"The selling of the work is not important; what's important is the fact that someone is willing to pay you for something you created."
"You can do anything here, absolutely anything."
"The only thing worse than yellow snow, is green snow."
"Just like any muscle in your body, your imagination increases proportionately to the amount of practice you give it."
"If there's any secret to anything that you're ever good at, it's just practice."
"Grab it, lift it, fluff it."
"There are no limits here."
"I believe every day's a good day when you paint."
"Gotta give him a friend. Like I always say: 'Everyone needs a friend.'"
"Heh. Isn't that sneaky?"
"Just pretend you're a whisper, floating across the mountain."
"The trees are oh so soft… oh so soft I freakin' love it."
"We want happy paintings. Happy paintings. If you want sad things, watch the news."
"And we don't care if some of these little hangy-downs off the brush get down here - we'll just turn those into reflections. We'll use them rascals."
"We're gonna make some big decisions in our little world."
"I can't go over 30 minutes, because we have a mean ol' director with no sense of humor."
"And just go straight in like you're gonna stab it. And barely touch it… barely touch it."
"Proportionately, I'm using much more crimson than blue."
"Let's just blend this little rascal here… Ha! Happy as we can be."
"Clouds are very, very free."
"Just sparkle that where you want the sun to really zing through and shine. Just sparkle."
"Just put a few do-ers in there."
"That's a one-way ticket to Agony City."
"Just scrape in a few indications of sticks and twigs and other little things in there. People will think you spent hours doing this."
"Decide where your little footy hills live."
"If you did this with yellow, and you went over it with blue, you would end up with a… with a translucent… green. And it's gorgeous. It is GORGEOUS."
"All you're doing is just tap, tap, tap. Just like the ol' tap dancers did, that's all you have to do. Tap out a happy little tune here, and let it go."
"It's so important to do something every day that will make you happy."
"Yep, you're right - there's a tree. Tell you what, let's have another one."
"Sometimes your tongue gets over your eye teeth and you can't see what you're saying."
"Maybe over here lives… yep. Some big ol', big ol', big ol', big ol' tree limb."
"We were tearing down an old house, and we threw out a box, and son of a gun - two little baby squirrels rolled out."
"This is a lazy man's way of painting. That's why I like it so much - I'm basically a very lazy person."
"Don't wanna over-blend this, I want to leave it sort of rough… and ragged. That's what my dog says, \"ruff!\""
"And just that easy, we've got a fantastic little sky."
"I want to create the illusion of mist."
"Remember our Golden Rule: a thin paint will stick to a thick paint."
"These two trees are good buddies; they live next door to each other. And maybe here and there there's a happy little bush or so that grows right down by his foots."
"Don't want it to look like it's floating around and just having a good time - push that rascal down in there."
"Today, let's have a… let's have a happy little painting."
"See, already that makes a dynamite sky. Beautiful little sky."
"And all we're doing, once again, is just tapping. Just tap, tap."
"Someone sent me a letter here a while back and said that I use the word \"happy\" too much, that everything was happy in my world… And that's true - in my world, everything is happy."
"You can turn the brush sidewards, and make different little effects if you want 'em."
"That misty area is most, most important - it's your friend."
"I get crazy sometimes and like to do… wild things."
"You want a dry brush for this. If your brush is wet, you'll become a mud mixer."
